Interface HyperparameterConfigurable

All Known Subinterfaces:
BatchSizeConfigurable, EpochConfigurable, LearningRateConfigurable<N>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdaGrad, Adam, AdamW, ARGOptimizer, DelegatedRegime, DumpNodesRegime, ElasticNet, EpochRegime, GradientDescentOptimizer, LASSO, MiniBatchRegime, ObjectiveReportingRegime, Ridge, RMSProp, VanillaGradientDescent
public interface HyperparameterConfigurable
Interface for components that expose tunable hyperparameters.

Hyperparameters are configuration values that control the behavior of a model or algorithm (e.g., learning rate, momentum, batch size) but are not learned directly from data. This interface provides a generic mechanism to inspect and update such values at runtime.

  • Method Details

    • hasHyperparameter

      default boolean hasHyperparameter(String name)

    • getHyperparameters

      Map<String,Object> getHyperparameters()
      Returns a snapshot of all current hyperparameters.

      The returned map should contain stable, human-readable keys (such as "learningRate" or "momentum") mapped to their current values. Implementations are encouraged to return a defensive copy so that external modifications do not affect the internal state.

      Returns:
      an immutable or defensive copy of the current hyperparameters

    • getHyperparameter

      default Object getHyperparameter(String name)
      Returns the value of a single hyperparameter by name.

      This is a convenience method that queries getHyperparameters(). If the name is not present, this will return null.

      Parameters:
      name - the hyperparameter name
      Returns:
      the hyperparameter value, or null if not defined

    • getHyperparameter

      default <T> T getHyperparameter(String name, Class<T> hyperparameterTypeClass)
      Returns the value of a single hyperparameter by name, cast to the expected type.

      This is a convenience method that queries getHyperparameters() and casts the result to the requested type. If the name is not present, this will return null. If the value is present but not of the expected type, a ClassCastException will be thrown.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type parameter corresponding to the expected value type
      Parameters:
      name - the hyperparameter name
      hyperparameterTypeClass - the expected type of the value
      Returns:
      the hyperparameter value cast to the requested type, or null if not defined
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the value cannot be cast to the given type

    • setHyperparameters

      default void setHyperparameters(Map<String,Object> hyperparameters)
      Updates multiple hyperparameters at once by name.

      Implementations should validate the input and either:

      • ignore unknown keys, or
      • throw an IllegalArgumentException if an unrecognized hyperparameter is provided.
      Parameters:
      hyperparameters - a map of hyperparameter names to new values
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any value is invalid or a key is unrecognized

    • setHyperparameter

      void setHyperparameter(String name, Object value)
      Updates a single hyperparameter by name.
      Parameters:
      name - the hyperparameter name
      value - the new hyperparameter value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is unrecognized or the value is invalid
